A RESOLUTION strengthening public safety: 'speaker_3': 'Agenda Item two Resolution 317 75 Strengthening Public Safety by affirming the city's support for immigrant and refugee witnesses, survivors and victims of crime.'
'speaker_2': 'Also, Councilmember Gonzales.'

'speaker_4': 'Okay. So this resolution supports immigrant victims or witnesses of crime, as well as immigrant survivors of abuse and affirms the city's support and practices around asking about immigration status. 'speaker_4': 'This resolution commits the city to working with trusted community based organizations to support outreach and capacity building so that individuals who aren't aware of the fact that they qualify for this type of certification are made aware of the fact that this is this is an option that is currently available to them in our community.'

'speaker_4': 'I want to extend a big thank you to Appalachia, and we're up as well as we have. Yes. And Grace Wong for Lee for lending their expertize to us on supporting immigrant survivors and immigrant victims or witnesses of crimes.'

'speaker_0': 'It's been.'

'speaker_4': 'I would just say that in this climate where we continue to hear from our Department of Justice and the President, that that public safety is compromised by having undocumented immigrants in our community, that this resolution really affirms the fact that that is absolutely false and that we know that that there is a disproportionality in terms of the'

'speaker_4': 'crime that is experienced by communities who belong to the immigrant and refugee community, whether they're documented or not. 'speaker_4': 'And just some quick numbers that I wanted to share. 'speaker_4': 'The rate of intimate partner homicide is higher among marginalized populations than their white counterparts at the rate of two times or higher in terms of marginalized populations and the disproportionate impact there.
